title: FormloSerif / formloSans
content:
formloSerif / formloSans   
   
ive created these, to exchange my mobile   
phone operator logo with my own logotype...   
please, let me know what you think...   
   
 ![formlos_ffamily.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205859im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/837.gif)
author: Dav

comments.content: very slick, like it. my fave is the sans.

I just finished work on the [formlos PxlSerif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205859/http:/www.formlos.net/formlosTF/PxlSerif) and [formlos PxlSans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205859/http:/www.formlos.net/formlosTF/PxlSans) types.. They will soon be available for Sale at [formlos, Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205859/http:/www.formlos.net/formlosTF).. Be sure to take a look at them, at.: [www.formlos.net/formlosTF/PxlSans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205859/http:/www.formlos.net/formlosTF/PxlSans), [www.formlos.net/formlosTF/PxlSerif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205859/http:/www.formlos.net/formlosTF/PxlSerif)

thank you...   
yes, i also think that it may work better for   
navigation / headlines than for body text...   
hopefully, people are still interested in those   
kind of fonts...

Congratulations with your release!   
   
To my knowledge, this is the very first font in   
these forums that has gone from critique to   
actual market. (If there are others, they haven't   
let us know.)   
   
I like this, however it performs much better   
in limited quantities (e.g. for navigation or   
headers) versus the way you show it on your   
site as body text.   
   
You may have success including a   
sample on your site at 2x or even 3x scale. I   
know Matthew Bardram has had success with   
his bitmap fonts selling as display faces for   
print.   
   
Good luck with it.
